message: I want to buy my parents a universal remote. are the harmonies easy to use?

Amazon has a ton of reviews, that would probably be a good place to figure your question out:http://www.amazon.com/s/ref=nb_sb_ss_i_0_16?url=search-alias%3Daps&field-keywords=logitech+harmony&x=0&y=0&sprefix=logitech+harmony

I have a harmony one.  It works fine, but the "activity" buttons aren't very robust.  For an activity, the remote broadcasts a series of commands, but does not get an ack if the command was successful.  The result of this is that I frequently wind up in an activity mode, but still have to navigate the menus to turn on a device or switch an input.   (For this reason, I would never get one for my parents)
I got one at one point. Used it for about a night. The thing was just slower than shit. I could flip through things with multiple remotes faster than it kept up.

@davisp brings up a good point. In stock setup, the button response time on Harmony remotes is slooooooow. But you can tweak the responsiveness. Logitech's software calls it "delay between button presses" and measures it in milliseconds
